key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle privately congratulated Prince William and Kate Middleton on their tenth wedding anniversary.
The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge celebrated their tenth wedding anniversary, having been married at Westminster Abbey in 2011.
Various members of the royal family, including Queen Elizabeth and Prince Charles, shared tributes on social media.
Queen Elizabeth's official Royal Family Instagram account and Prince Charles' Clarence House account posted anniversary tributes.
Prince Harry, having no social media account, chose a private manner to send his congratulations.
The royal family reminisced about William and Kate's wedding day through social media posts and interviews.
Garrison Sergeant Major Bill Mott, who was involved in organizing the wedding procession, had to miss the ceremony for work reasons.
Mott gave up his wedding invitation to ensure the proper organization of military personnel during the event.
Despite missing the ceremony, Mott highlighted the positive atmosphere and public excitement on the wedding day.
The anniversary celebrations highlight the continued public interest and affection for the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge.
